programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: No. 3 seed Atlanta Drive GC meets No. 4 seed New York Golf Club in the third and final match of a best-of-three series to determine the inaugural champion; Atlanta's Billy Horschel led TGL in singles points during the regular season with eight.

programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: Host Scott Van Pelt covers all of the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: No. 3 seed Atlanta Drive GC faces No. 4 seed New York Golf Club in second match of a best-of-three series to determine the inaugural season champion; Atlanta Drive GC defeated New York Golf Club in the regular season with a 4-0 victory on Jan. 21.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Los Angeles claimed a 124-117 victory over Indiana in their first meeting of the season on Feb. 8, led by 45 points and 7 assists from Austin Reaves; Pascal Siakam posted 23 points and 6 rebounds for the Pacers in the loss on the road.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Invitational
programme.desc: Illinois State/Incarnate Word winner goes up against the Florida Gulf Coast/Cleveland State winner in the championship game of the annual tournament; Seattle won the title last year, defeating High Point in the final, 77-67, behind Cameron Tyson.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Main event bouts from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged between longtime rivals and impressive victories are featured.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: North Texas (26-8) beat Arkansas State, 65-63, behind a game-winner from Jasper Floyd with two seconds left, and beat the Cowboys in the 2023 NIT, 65-59; Oklahoma State (17-17) held on to defeat SMU, 85-83, behind 24 points from Bryce Thompson.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Kent State (24-11) held on to defeat Stanford, 77-75, behind 34 points from Jalen Sullinger and a double-double from Delrecco Gillespie; Loyola (24-11) upset No. 1 seed San Francisco, 77-76, behind a career-high 35 points from Jayden Dawson.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Chattanooga (26-9) upset No. 1 seed Dayton, 87-72, to advance behind 26 points from Honor Huff and 25 points from Trey Bonham; Bradley (28-8) defeated George Mason, 75-67, behind 21 points from both Christian Davis and Corey Thomas.

programme.desc: UAB (24-12) used a strong fourth quarter to beat Santa Clara, 88-84, behind 22 points, 11 rebounds and seven assists from Yaxel Lendeborg; UC Irvine (30-6) held on to beat Jacksonville State, 66-61, behind 22 points from Justin Hohn.

programme.title: SC Featured
programme.desc: Mike Legg scored a goal for the Michigan Wolverines during the 1996 NCAA Hockey Tournament that started a revolution in the sport, as players, both amateur and professional, took the ice looking to replicate the lacrosse-style goal.

programme.desc: Director Kirk Fraser takes an in-depth look at what truly happened on the night that college basketball star Len Bias died of a cocaine overdose just 48 hours after being drafted second overall by the Boston Celtics in 1986.

programme.title: NCAA Studio Update
programme.desc: The latest news and results from the NCAA Championship Tournament; coverage includes highlights of the most recent games and in-depth analysis from experts as well as the latest injury updates and insightful reports on teams from across the country.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Yoshinobu Yamamoto is expected to start for the Dodgers after pitching 90 innings last season and finishing with a 7-2 record and an ERA of 3.00; Shota Imanaga pitches for the Cubs and was 15-3 with a 2.91 ERA last season.

programme.title: UEFA World Cup Qualifying Matchweek Highlights
Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: 2026 UEFA World Cup Qualifiers
programme.desc: Norway is coming off of a 1-0 win against Belgium in the Nations League group stage on Nov. 11 through a winner from Yarden Shua; Norway claimed a 5-0 victory over Kazakhstan in their group, led by a hat-trick from Erling Haaland.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: CONCACAF Gold Cup Soccer
programme.desc: Trinidad & Tobago claimed a 2-1 advantage over Cuba in the first leg of the preliminary round on March 21 through goals from Isaiah Lee and Steffen Yeates; Yasniel Matos found the net for Cuba's lone goal of the match to open the scoring.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: CONCACAF Gold Cup Soccer
programme.desc: Costa Rica claimed a 7-0 advantage over Belize in the first leg of the preliminary round on March 21, led by a brace from Manfred Ugalde in the first half; Alonso Martnez provided a pair of assists in the first half to make it, 3-0, at half-time.

programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Roki Sasaki appeared in two spring training games for the Dodgers and recorded seven strikeouts over seven innings with a 0.00 ERA; Justin Steele threw 134.2 innings in 24 starts for the Cubs last season, and he was 5-5 with a 3.07 ERA.

programme.title: Walk-Off Stories
programme.desc: National League MVP Kirk Gibson, who was hobbled by leg injuries in the NLCS, was used as a pinch-hitter in Game 1 of the 1988 World Series, his only at-bat of the series, and would provide one of the most memorable home runs in MLB history.

programme.title: CONCACAF Gold Cup Soccer
programme.desc: Honduras claimed a 5-3 advantage over Bermuda in the first leg of the preliminary round on March 21, led by a pair of goals from Romell Quioto in the second half; Luis Palma found the net and added an assist for Honduras to come back from down, 2-0.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Antron Brown leads Shawn Langdon in Top Fuel by 22 points, Chad Green leads Ron Capps in Funny Car by 14 points and Dallas Glenn leads Greg Anderson in Pro Stock by 18 points after Gainesville, the first event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Josh Berry secured his first Cup Series win of his career with his victory at Las Vegas over Daniel Suarez, ending the three-race win streak of Christopher Bell; Tyler Reddick averaged 129.379 mph to win at Homestead last year over Ryan Blaney.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Port Adelaide (1-1-0) has won the past eight meetings with the Bombers, including a 111-42 victory last season, as Connor Rozee had a career-high 36 disposals and kicked three goals; Essendon (0-2-0) comes off a 161-100 loss to Adelaide in Round 2.

programme.title: The Rover of Tobruk
programme.desc: The life of Bob Quinn was much more than becoming a legend and captain for the Port Adelaide Football Club, serving his country of Australia during World War II and receiving the Military Medal for his actions during the Siege of Tobruk.

programme.title: NASCAR Masters of the Clock: The Legend of Martinsville
programme.desc: Martinsville Speedway remains as the lone race track to be a part of the NASCAR circuit since its inception in 1948 and remains the shortest track on the Sprint Cup Series schedule, and drivers share some of their memories racing in Virginia.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.title: Copa America 2024: Argentina's Road to Glory
NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: Dolphins (0-0-3) is just 1-0-3 all-time against Brisbane (2-0-1) but won the last meeting with a 40-6 triumph last season at Suncorp Stadium in Round 26, as Jake Averillo, Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow and Herbie Farnworth each notched a brace.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: San Antonio (7-3) led the UFL in total defense and scoring defense after allowing just 256.7 yards per game and 15.3 points per contest; St. Louis (7-3) won both encounters against the Brahmas this season after its 13-12 triumph at home in Week 10.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Birmingham defeated Michigan, 31-18, to advance behind two passing TDs from Matt Corral; San Antonio beat St. Louis, 25-15, and won its season meeting with the Stallions, 18-9, on May 25 behind two rushing touchdowns from Morgan Ellison.

programme.title: NRL Hits Vegas
programme.desc: The NRL stepped outside of Australia to open its 2024 season under the bright, neon lights of Las Vegas, as the documentary shows all-access footage and interviews with the people that made it happen and the players who got a unique experience.

programme.title: Pickleball
programme.desc: The James has been named the official and exclusive hospital of the upcoming 2024 APP Vlasic Classic in Cincinnati on May 7-12.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: Big-money poker events in some of Europe's most exclusive and exciting destinations, features some of the best players in the world attempting to take huge pots by employing the right strategy and taking advantage of their opponents' mistakes.
